intro: Margyricarpus paucijugatus, commonly known as the few-lobed cupule plant, is a rare and specialized member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, cup-like structure that encloses its fruits, a feature that distinguishes it from many other members of its family. The plant exhibits a complex arrangement of bracts and carpophylls, which contribute to its distinctive morphology. It is typically found in specific microhabitats, often in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specialized requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically rare species.
